data.title: Not so great lobster roll
data.text:
We bought the lobster roll box set and two sliders. The lobster roll was pretty disappointing. Very wet bread (not sure why), more lettuce than meat, and almost minced lobster meat. Sliders were just ok. Not much flavor. 

I really hate giving bad reviews but probably wouldn't try those again!

data.title: Just OK
data.text:
I have been to this one a while back, on RT1 at the intersection of King Street near Ross clothing shop.
  There's a couple places like this but they are all just ok!  This one was very clean, good employees but the food was just average nada special.  The veggy burger was really bland no flavor at all, I Althing they need a whole new supplier for their veggy burger!
  Toppings and buns get a A thou, real fresh veggies Nd A+ for there jalepenos which are blazing hot and good.

data.title: Great food
data.text: If you like burgers, this place is a must! Everyone in our party loved their food. The prices were very reasonable too. What we liked most was the casual atmosphere and top notch service.

data.title: Lobster roll
data.text: Won't do that again.  It looked wonderful but the roll was very dry, some of the lobster meat had been way overcooked.  To bad. It could have been excellent.

owner_response.author: Nate R, Owner at The Burger Joint, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are terribly sorry to hear about your recent experience at BGR. We want to thank you for taking the time to write your review and provide us with feedback. Our top priority is providing our customers with outstanding food, so we apologize for not meeting expectations with the Lobster Roll. Please know we take your opinion very seriously, and we  hope you’ll give us another chance to earn your patronage in the future.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Best Burger
data.text: The burger joint on Washingtonstreet in old town Alexandria is noisy but quite good groups restaurant and is open till 11pm on weekends and provide take outs too.prices are reasonable while ambianceis average . the Wellington burger and onion rings are the best in menu.

data.title: The worst food experience in several years!
data.text:
The burger I ordered took 15 minutes to make ( no one else in the store) and was absolutely the lowest grade beef that was possible to pass quality inspection. The grease from this burger saturated both buns and enough dripped onto the paper that i could have soaked another piece of bread with it. I could only eat about 3 bites before the grease just turned my stomach. Disgusting is not the word for it.
It looked like a murder scene from a B movie on the paper.
Will NEVER go back!!

data.title: Average
data.text: Love a good burger so I go elsewhere.  Not bad but there are better to be had in the area.  Shakes are good.

data.title: Nothing special
data.text: Went once while I was at a meeting. It's a hamburger joint. Expect congeniality, good food, and prompt service.

data.title: Good Burgers
data.text: The Burger Joint has very tasty burgers and great fries.  Not really sure how it compares to most of its competitors since we tend not to eat out often for burgers (too easy at home).  Nice location (parking is a pain in downtown Old Town) for foot traffic.  Cost is a bit high but again, now out of line with other similar burger joints.

data.title: Okay place/food
data.text: We patronized this restaurant on a late afternoon.  We were the only two customers. Our entrance was hardly acknowledged -- the service, considering the 'lack of competition' was not really very good.  Both of us had burgers -- they were okay, but certainly not 'knock your socks off'.  While we are not likely to be there in the future, it is not a restaurant to which I would return!

data.title: Really good lunch option!
data.text:
The burgers here are really good!  I love that they have so many options.  You can pick various combinations or create your own.  Everything is made right on an open grill - and you can see how fresh the ingredients are.  No frozen burger patties here!!

I thought the prices were good - I think the combo prices could be a little better.

There was not a great deal of options for small kids.  I would say that could use some improvement.

The best part?  Definitely the burgers.  If you are looking for a good burger in Old Town - this is a really good option!

data.title: The best burger in Old town Alexandria.
data.text:
Fire grilled burgers and Yukon gold fries.  Doesn't get any better than this.  This is my local place and I visit often.  I like my burger well done and they cook it that way without it being too dry and overcooked.

They have beer and milkshakes.  You can use the BGR app and order online for pickup.  

If you are in Alexandria, stop in and have a great burger.

data.title: The best burger you will ever have in No. VA
data.text:
Dry aged beef tastes so different from those Five Guys and other places in the area AND if you really are a medium rare to rare burger kind of person, this is the place.  Go somewhere else and order a burger and you can only get it done medium.  Wonder why?
I go back to the BGR all the time.

data.title: Great Food for great price
data.text: Great food and product offered when on a tight budget! Yumi for the tumi! U will get full when done!

data.title: Yum!
data.text: Hamburger with mushroom onions & swiss cooked medium with fries!  Oh that was a good burger. The flame cooked meat was juicy and delicious, and the fries were perfect. The staff was gracious and helpful when we asked about nuts & peanuts so that my son could safely eat here. They advised us to avoid the desserts, which wasn't a problem because the burger and fries were more than filling. Yum!

data.title: A Delicious Burger
data.text:
My burger was high quality beef, charred outside and rare in the middle as requested. The bun and trimmings were fresh and tasty.  The onion rings were huge and sweet.  The iced tea tasted fresh brewed.  

The food is prepared to order, so be prepared to wait a few minutes after ordering, and for a fairly noisy environment.

This restaurant is in the downtown space occupied by a small pharmacy in the 20th century, and they obviously spend their money on the food, not the decor, but they do a first rate job at what they set out to do.  I'll be back next time I'm in the mood for a hamburger.

data.title: Expensive Fast Food, Better Value for Same Food Down the Street
data.text: The burger was good, but for fast food self service it's expensive. And the wait time is too long. I can go down on King closer to the water at one of several restaurants, get a burger with fries or other side, for less than this and be waited on by waiter/server. No value here and the place is just a noisey fast food place. Better value down the street.

data.title: BGR????? Bring ur appetite
data.text: The box set looks like the way to go. You get a burger, drink and fries. VG  price. Flame broiled A+. You can smell the grill on the burger AA++. FRIES come out on the  plate with the burger, like they should be. I don't need bag or box to hold them. Free basic toppings. Got the 'spice it up' version. Fried jalapeños, pepper jack cheese and onions.  2 hands needed to hold this burger. Asked for medium cooked and it came out perfect. They know what they are doing. I know its only a burger, but a lot of people do not know really how to make it - simple, tasty, good, flavorful, presentation. Staff friendly, helpful and clean.  Great job to this location

data.title: Mmmm... Burgers
data.text: You want burgers? Come here to get some burgers. The ambiance is fantastic (funky lights and blown up album covers), and the staff is nice. Pricey, but worth the cost.

data.title: Great take out
data.text: Went here to cure my burger craving and got the veggie burger. One of the best I have ever had. Had their lunch special which is a burger and fries. The burger was so moist it was falling apart. Couldn't eat all of it so I had leftovers for a few days.
